answers.Question: Who patented the computing scale in 1885?
answers.sentences: Julius E. Pitrap patented the computing scale in 1885; Alexander Dey invented the dial recorder (1888); Herman Hollerith (1860–1929) patented the Electric Tabulating Machine; and Willard Bundy invented a time clock to record a worker's arrival and departure time on a paper tape in 1889.

answers.Question: When did Willard Bundy invented a time clock?
answers.sentences: Julius E. Pitrap patented the computing scale in 1885; Alexander Dey invented the dial recorder (1888); Herman Hollerith (1860–1929) patented the Electric Tabulating Machine; and Willard Bundy invented a time clock to record a worker's arrival and departure time on a paper tape in 1889.

answers.Question: Where is J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. headquartered?
answers.sentences: J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. is an American multinational investment bank and financial services company headquartered in New York City.

answers.Question: Who was elected India's 14th president?
answers.sentences: From the 14th to the 18th centuries, India's literary traditions went through a period of drastic change because of the emergence of devotional poets such as Kabīr, Tulsīdās, and Guru Nānak.

answers.Question: When had the small states and chiefdoms of the Ganges Plain and the north-western regions consolidated?
answers.sentences: In the late Vedic period, around the 6th century BCE, the small states and chiefdoms of the Ganges Plain and the north-western regions had consolidated into 16 major oligarchies and monarchies that were known as the mahajanapadas.

answers.Question: Where did an office of the Equitable Eastern Banking Corporation opened a branch in 1921?
answers.sentences: An office of the Equitable Eastern Banking Corporation (one of J.P. Morgan's predecessors) opened a branch in China in 1921 and Chase National Bank was established there in 1923.

answers.Question: Who was convicted for financial crimes related to bond swaps in November 2009?
answers.sentences:
Jefferson County, Alabama
In November 2009, a week after Birmingham, Alabama Mayor Larry Langford was convicted for financial crimes related to bond swaps for Jefferson County, Alabama, JPMorgan Chase & Co. agreed to a $722 million settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to end a probe into the sales of derivatives that allegedly contributed to the near-bankruptcy of the county.

answers.Question: Where is Tesla's European Distribution Center located?
answers.sentences: For the European market, a final assembly plant and European Distribution Center are part of the Tesla facilities in Tilburg, Netherlands.

answers.Question: Who named the lands of the Western Hemisphere America?
answers.sentences:
Etymology
In 1507, the German cartographer Martin Waldseemüller produced a world map on which he named the lands of the Western Hemisphere America in honor of the Italian explorer and cartographer Amerigo Vespucci (Latin: Americus Vespucius).

answers.Question: When did Washington state legalize same-sex marriage?
answers.sentences: Along with Colorado, Washington was one of the first to legalize medicinal and recreational cannabis, was among the first thirty-six states to legalize same-sex marriage, doing so in 2012, and was one of only four U.S. states to have been providing legal abortions on request before the 1973 Supreme Court decision in Roe v. Wade loosened federal abortion laws.

answers.Question: Who left and sold his share of the company back to Jobs and Wozniak for $800?

answers.Question: When was the first personal computer without a programming language sold?
answers.sentences:
1984–1991: Success with Macintosh

In 1984, Apple launched the Macintosh, the first personal computer to be sold without a programming language.

answers.Question: When was CitiGroup Inc. created?

History
Citigroup was formed on October 8, 1998, following the $140 billion merger of Citicorp and Travelers Group to create the world's largest financial services organization.
